cards.flavor: Bant's armies are primarily composed of members of the Mortar caste, loyal commoners who haven't yet earned a sigil.
cards.name: Akrasan Squire
cards.text: Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.flavor: Rigorous faith and belief are rewarded on occasion, and richly so.
cards.name: Angel's Herald
cards.text: {2}{W}, {T}, Sacrifice a green creature, a white creature, and a blue creature: Search your library for a card named Empyrial Archangel and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"Even in single combat, I am never alone."
—Rafiq of the Many
cards.name: Angelic Benediction
cards.text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, you may tap target creature.

cards.flavor: Clash of sword and cry of beast fall mute when angels sound the call to prayer.
cards.name: Angelsong
cards.text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.flavor: "A night attack will be easy. We'll make an air raid over the Akrasan border. Just get me some flint to light the war torches."
cards.name: Bant Battlemage
cards.text:
{G}, {T}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn.
{U}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Battlegrace Angel
cards.text:
Flying
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, it gains lifelink until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Naya's trees grow tall and sturdy. Their foliage intertwines to form dewcups, rainwater pools where the elves gather to celebrate life.
cards.name: Cradle of Vitality
cards.text: Whenever you gain life, you may pay {1}{W}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature for each 1 life you gained.

cards.flavor:
"I find its symmetry pleasing. It rids our world of offensive refuse while disposing of itself."
—Dolomarus, Proctor of the Clean
cards.name: Dispeller's Capsule
cards.text: {2}{W}, {T}, Sacrifice Dispeller's Capsule: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Elspeth, Knight-Errant
cards.text:
+1: Put a 1/1 white Soldier creature token onto the battlefield.
+1: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn.
−8: You get an emblem with "Artifacts, creatures, enchantments, and lands you control have indestructible."

cards.flavor: "The noble work of our order is to infuse all life on Esper with etherium. Our goal will be reached more rapidly if new life is . . . suppressed."
cards.name: Ethersworn Canonist
cards.text: Each player who has cast a nonartifact spell this turn can't cast additional nonartifact spells.

cards.flavor: Rebels and other malcontents forced into the ritual awake lost in Topa's vast savannahs. Those who find their way back return humble and repentant.
cards.name: Excommunicate
cards.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

cards.flavor:
"Only by the bravery of those who put loyalty above glory is our home kept safe."
—Elspeth
cards.name: Guardians of Akrasa
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.flavor: "The elves claim the canopy. The nacatl claim the mountains. I suppose you think we ought to stay on the jungle floor?"
cards.name: Gustrider Exuberant
cards.text:
Flying
Sacrifice Gustrider Exuberant: Creatures you control with power 5 or greater gain flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Bantians believe those who are born into the highest caste and live a life of discipline and virtue can ascend to become angels.
cards.name: Invincible Hymn
cards.text: Count the number of cards in your library. Your life total becomes that number.

cards.flavor: The Order of the Skyward Eye does the bidding of an evil force, unwittingly stirring fear and mistrust across Bant in accordance with his plans.
cards.name: Knight of the Skyward Eye
cards.text: {3}{G}: Knight of the Skyward Eye gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.flavor: Both guide and guard on open plain.
cards.name: Knight of the White Orchid
cards.text:
First strike
When Knight of the White Orchid enters the battlefield, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for a Plains card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: The strength of Bant's caste system is the unfailing loyalty of its meekest members.
cards.name: Knight-Captain of Eos
cards.text:
When Knight-Captain of Eos enters the battlefield, put two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.
{W}, Sacrifice a Soldier: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.flavor: The cup was a gift from the sphinx Tameron, who hoped that those who drank from it would live long enough to decrypt the sphinxes' wisdom.
cards.name: Marble Chalice
cards.text: {T}: You gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: "By the time I got there, the heart had stopped. Fortunately, I was able to replace it with something better."
cards.name: Metallurgeon
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Regenerate target artifact.

cards.flavor: A circle of light and a word of confinement.
cards.name: Oblivion Ring
cards.text:
When Oblivion Ring enters the battlefield, exile another target nonland permanent.
When Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.flavor: At his side, humble beasts become weapons more deadly than sharpened steel.
cards.name: Ranger of Eos
cards.text: When Ranger of Eos enters the battlefield, you may search your library for up to two creature cards with converted mana cost 1 or less, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Resounding Silence
cards.text:
Exile target attacking creature.
Cycling {5}{G}{W}{U} ({5}{G}{W}{U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Resounding Silence, exile up to two target attacking creatures.

cards.flavor:
"Aven bandits can be sly. You've got to fill the sky with boulders—and then seek cover immediately."
—Knight-Captain Wyhorn
cards.name: Rockcaster Platoon
cards.text: {4}{G}: Rockcaster Platoon deals 2 damage to each creature with flying and each player.

cards.flavor: As their supplies of etherium dwindled, mechanists sent gargoyles farther and farther afield in search of salvage.
cards.name: Sanctum Gargoyle
cards.text:
Flying
When Sanctum Gargoyle enters the battlefield, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor:
"Soon I will sleep, eyes closing to a world tarnished with flesh, and then wake to a polished vision."
—Sharuum
cards.name: Scourglass
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Scourglass: Destroy all permanents except for artifacts and lands. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Sighted-Caste Sorcerer
cards.text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{U}: Sighted-Caste Sorcerer gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.flavor: Each sigil marks the recognition of a great deed and signifies a duty owed to the one who granted it.
cards.name: Sigiled Paladin
cards.text:
First strike
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.flavor: An avatar he sculpts of fellowship and light.
cards.name: Soul's Grace
cards.text: You gain life equal to target creature's power.

cards.flavor: Sunseeders quest for areas of open sky. They train plowbeasts to beat back the dense jungle long enough to cultivate a crop.
cards.name: Sunseed Nurturer
cards.text:
At the beginning of your end step, if you control a creature with power 5 or greater, you may gain 2 life.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"Those talons really dig into your skin, but it's better than being dropped."
—Rafiq of the Many
cards.name: Welkin Guide
cards.text:
Flying
When Welkin Guide enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"It is sacrilege to confine a gargantuan to the grinding of straight lines. I will pray that it remembers who is the master of this land."
—Syeena, elvish godtoucher
cards.name: Yoked Plowbeast
cards.text: Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.flavor: On Bant, a sigil is both a prize of honor and a bond of duty. The one who bears it may be called to fulfill that charge at any moment.
cards.name: Call to Heel
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. Its controller draws a card.

cards.flavor: "What you are attempting is not against the law. It is, however, extremely foolish."
cards.name: Cancel
cards.text: Counter target spell.

cards.flavor: "Forget. Only then will there be space for hope between the pain and fear."
cards.name: Cathartic Adept
cards.text: {T}: Target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor: A permanent storm rages over the plain of Cloudheath, and drakes ride its currents—two reminders that some elements of Esper will not be controlled.
cards.name: Cloudheath Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{W}: Cloudheath Drake gains vigilance until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Etherium does not know sleep. Only magic can teach it the resting state of cold steel.
cards.name: Coma Veil
cards.text:
Enchant artifact or creature
Enchanted permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.flavor: In ages past, Esper couriers bore messages written on ornate scrolls. The medium has grown more sophisticated, but the principle remains the same.
cards.name: Courier's Capsule
cards.text: {1}{U}, {T}, Sacrifice Courier's Capsule: Draw two cards.

cards.flavor: Before signing anything on Grixis, always read the fine print.
cards.name: Covenant of Minds
cards.text: Reveal the top three cards of your library. Target opponent may choose to put those cards into your hand. If he or she doesn't, put those cards into your graveyard and draw five cards.

cards.flavor: Their shots are fired most often as signals—or at those who didn't get the message.
cards.name: Dawnray Archer
cards.text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{W}, {T}: Dawnray Archer deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.flavor: She can heal the flesh, or exploit its many weaknesses.
cards.name: Esper Battlemage
cards.text:
{W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
{B}, {T}: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Speculation is foolish when the tools of certainty are available."
—Cinna, vedalken consul
cards.name: Etherium Astrolabe
cards.text:
Flash
{B}, {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: The greatest masters of the craft abandon tools altogether, shaping metal with hand and mind alone.
cards.name: Etherium Sculptor
cards.text: Artifact spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

cards.name: Fatestitcher
cards.text:
{T}: You may tap or untap another target permanent.
Unearth {U} ({U}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: "We of the Sanctum Arcanum have pondered every word on every page of the Filigree Texts. If you can't say the same, don't bother speaking."
cards.name: Filigree Sages
cards.text: {2}{U}: Untap target artifact.

cards.flavor:
"It's free to do whatever it wants. I've merely told it what that is."
—Xorin, Architect of Will
cards.name: Gather Specimens
cards.text: If a creature would enter the battlefield under an opponent's control this turn, it enters the battlefield under your control instead.

cards.flavor: She stands ready, always watchful, knowing that weeks of peace and serenity can be overturned by a single distant sail.
cards.name: Jhessian Lookout
Kathari Screecher
cards.text:
Flying
Unearth {2}{U} ({2}{U}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Kederekt Leviathan
cards.text:
When Kederekt Leviathan enters the battlefield, return all other nonland permanents to their owners' hands.
Unearth {6}{U} ({6}{U}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: "Only a mind unfettered with the concerns of the flesh can see the world as it truly is."
cards.name: Master of Etherium
cards.text:
Master of Etherium's power and toughness are each equal to the number of artifacts you control.
Other artifact creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.flavor:
"The Filigree Texts do not compel you to act in accordance with their precepts. They only specify the consequences should you fail."
—Lodus of the Ethersworn
cards.name: Memory Erosion
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, that player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor: Rogue mechanists once rummaged through the wastes of the Tidehollow, constructing unauthorized golems to threaten the hegemony of the sphinxes. The orbs put a stop to that.
cards.name: Mindlock Orb
cards.text: Players can't search libraries.

cards.flavor: The island nation of Jhess is under constant siege from Valeron on the mainland. Riders traverse the coastline, always on the lookout for sails or aven.
cards.name: Outrider of Jhess
cards.text: Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.flavor:
"There is no such thing as scrap metal. All such material can be repaired with the proper bonding agent."
—Quennus, metallurgeon
cards.name: Protomatter Powder
cards.text: {4}{W}, {T}, Sacrifice Protomatter Powder: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Resounding Wave
cards.text:
Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
Cycling {5}{W}{U}{B} ({5}{W}{U}{B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Resounding Wave, return two target permanents to their owners' hands.

cards.flavor: Whether mechanical or biological, life finds a way to propagate itself.
cards.name: Sharding Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever an artifact creature you control deals combat damage to a player, you may put a 1/1 blue Thopter artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Skill Borrower
cards.text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
As long as the top card of your library is an artifact or creature card, Skill Borrower has all activated abilities of that card. (If any of the abilities use that card's name, use this creature's name instead.)

cards.flavor:
"Magic cast through a hand of flesh is just as weak as the flesh itself."
—Lodus of the Ethersworn
cards.name: Spell Snip
cards.text:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.flavor: He calls a riddle through the gaps of cloven clouds, hoping for an answer.
cards.name: Sphinx's Herald
cards.text: {2}{U}, {T}, Sacrifice a white creature, a blue creature, and a black creature: Search your library for a card named Sphinx Sovereign and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"From the highest towers to the deepest sea, all life must be touched by etherium."
—Lodus of the Ethersworn
cards.name: Steelclad Serpent
cards.text: Steelclad Serpent can't attack unless you control another artifact.

cards.name: Tezzeret the Seeker
cards.text:
+1: Untap up to two target artifacts.
−X: Search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost X or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
−5: Artifacts you control become artifact creatures with base power and toughness 5/5 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: At sea, the Jhessian fleet strikes swiftly and decisively. On land, facing the elite cavalry of Valeron, its marines must rely on more cautious strategies.
cards.name: Tortoise Formation
cards.text: Creatures you control gain shroud until end of turn. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)

cards.flavor: Even on Esper, there are those who eschew the use of magic in favor of simpler methods.
cards.name: Vectis Silencers
cards.text: {2}{B}: Vectis Silencers gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy that creature.)

cards.flavor: When the task spilled over into undeath, he stopped calling it his life's work.
cards.name: Ad Nauseam
cards.text: Reveal the top card of your library and put that card into your hand. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost. You may repeat this process any number of times.

cards.flavor: The necropolis at Unx was once a living city, its streets untrodden by death.
cards.name: Archdemon of Unx
cards.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a non-Zombie creature, then put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: The consuming undeath of Grixis terrifies the survivors of Vithia, but its fauna is just as fearsome.
cards.name: Banewasp Affliction
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, that creature's controller loses life equal to its toughness.

cards.flavor: Warriors of the Rip Clan wear their beetle-acid scars proudly, even modifying clothing and armor to better display the trophy.
cards.name: Blister Beetle
cards.text: When Blister Beetle enters the battlefield, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Witches of the Split-Eye Coven speak of a future when Grixis will overflow with life energy. For now, they must harvest vis from the living to fuel their dark magics.
cards.name: Bone Splinters
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Bone Splinters, sacrifice a creature.
Destroy target creature.

cards.name: Corpse Connoisseur
cards.text:
When Corpse Connoisseur enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a creature card and put that card into your graveyard. If you do, shuffle your library.
Unearth {3}{B} ({3}{B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: "Give me your memories, and you will have release from the suffering they bring you."
cards.name: Cunning Lethemancer
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each player discards a card.

cards.flavor: For the necromancer barons, killing and recruitment are one and the same.
cards.name: Death Baron
cards.text: Skeleton creatures you control and other Zombie creatures you control get +1/+1 and have deathtouch.

cards.flavor: "The bones of allies grant wisdom. The bones of enemies grant strength. The bones of dragons grant life eternal."
cards.name: Deathgreeter
cards.text: Whenever another creature dies, you may gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: "May these deaths be the first of many."
cards.name: Demon's Herald
cards.text: {2}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice a blue creature, a black creature, and a red creature: Search your library for a card named Prince of Thralls and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"On our thirty-fourth day of digging, we unearthed a chamber that contained the intact remains of several species long extinct from Grixis. One in particular should make a fine siege engine . . . ."
—Last notes of Shungus Nod, fleshcrafter
cards.name: Dreg Reaver

cards.flavor: The undead of Grixis are fueled by their hatred of the living.
cards.name: Dregscape Zombie
cards.text: Unearth {B} ({B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: There is always a moment of trepidation before opening a message capsule, for fear of the judgment that might be contained within.
cards.name: Executioner's Capsule
cards.text: {1}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice Executioner's Capsule: Destroy target nonblack creature.

cards.flavor: Grixis is a world where the only things found in abundance are death and decay. Corpses, whole or in part, are the standard currency among necromancers and demons.
cards.name: Fleshbag Marauder
cards.text: When Fleshbag Marauder enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.

cards.flavor: Before the zealots of the Ethersworn came to power, Esper illusionists dreamed up creations to mimic a variety of substances.
cards.name: Glaze Fiend
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever another artifact enters the battlefield under your control, Glaze Fiend gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Vitals of Grixis who eschew undeath must scrape and scratch to retain their mortality. The result is a breed of inventive mages.
cards.name: Grixis Battlemage
cards.text:
{U}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
{R}, {T}: Target creature can't block this turn.

cards.name: Immortal Coil
cards.text:
{T}, Exile two cards from your graveyard: Draw a card.
If damage would be dealt to you, prevent that damage. Exile a card from your graveyard for each 1 damage prevented this way.
When there are no cards in your graveyard, you lose the game.

cards.flavor:
"This is why we don't go out in banewasp weather."
—Rannon, Vithian holdout
cards.name: Infest
cards.text: All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The goblet was a gift from the sphinx Gorael, who hoped humans and vedalken would eventually destroy each other to acquire it, leaving all of Esper to her own kind.
cards.name: Onyx Goblet
cards.text: {T}: Target player loses 1 life.

cards.flavor: He scowls at his imperfect creation, then crushes it to scrap. He salvages the etherium and begins anew.
cards.name: Puppet Conjurer
cards.text:
{U}, {T}: Put a 0/1 blue Homunculus artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a Homunculus.

cards.name: Resounding Scream
cards.text:
Target player discards a card at random.
Cycling {5}{U}{B}{R} ({5}{U}{B}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Resounding Scream, target player discards two cards at random.

cards.name: Salvage Titan
cards.text:
You may sacrifice three artifacts rather than pay Salvage Titan's mana cost.
Exile three artifact cards from your graveyard: Return Salvage Titan from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Dragons consider drakes to be mockeries of their perfection, destroying them on sight.
cards.name: Scavenger Drake
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever another creature dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Scavenger Drake.

cards.flavor:
"The future is a snake, devouring your life backwards through time. And when you die, believe me, it doesn't stop feeding."
—Sedris, the Traitor King
cards.name: Shadowfeed
cards.text: Exile target card from a graveyard. You gain 3 life.

cards.flavor: Kathari, the sickly aven of Grixis, have learned that the corpses by the shoreline are more trap than treat.
cards.name: Shore Snapper
cards.text: {U}: Shore Snapper gains islandwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

cards.flavor: Undeath doesn't end the kathari's search for carrion; it only removes one corpse from the Dregscape.
cards.name: Skeletal Kathari
cards.text:
Flying
{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Skeletal Kathari.

cards.name: Tar Fiend
cards.text:
Devour 2 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with twice that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Tar Fiend enters the battlefield, target player discards a card for each creature it devoured.

cards.name: Undead Leotau
cards.text:
{R}: Undead Leotau gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
Unearth {2}{B} ({2}{B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Vein Drinker
cards.text:
Flying
{R}, {T}: Vein Drinker deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Vein Drinker.
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Vein Drinker this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Vein Drinker.

cards.name: Viscera Dragger
cards.text:
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
Unearth {1}{B} ({1}{B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Elementals born of Jund are as cruel and unstable as the plane itself.
cards.name: Bloodpyre Elemental
cards.text: Sacrifice Bloodpyre Elemental: Bloodpyre Elemental deals 4 damage to target creature. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.flavor: Naya's celebrants stoke the gargantuans into a rage, loosing a tide of muscle with the precision of an arrow.
cards.name: Bloodthorn Taunter
cards.text:
Haste
{T}: Target creature with power 5 or greater gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Caldera Hellion
cards.text:
Devour 1 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Caldera Hellion enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to each creature.

cards.flavor:
"The dragon is a perfect marriage of power and the will to use it."
—Sarkhan Vol
cards.name: Crucible of Fire
cards.text: Dragon creatures you control get +3/+3.

cards.flavor: Goblins journey to the sacrificial peaks in pairs so that the rare survivor might be able to relate the details of the other's grisly demise.
cards.name: Dragon Fodder
cards.text: Put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: The penultimate step of the ritual involves bathing in a delicious glaze.
cards.name: Dragon's Herald
cards.text: {2}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice a black creature, a red creature, and a green creature: Search your library for a card named Hellkite Overlord and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: The artistry of Etlan's firedancers is more spectacular when behemoths join in.
cards.name: Exuberant Firestoker
cards.text:
At the beginning of your end step, if you control a creature with power 5 or greater, you may have Exuberant Firestoker deal 2 damage to target player.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Dragon lords of Jund rule by edicts of flame.
cards.name: Flameblast Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Flameblast Dragon attacks, you may pay {X}{R}. If you do, Flameblast Dragon deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: A goblin raid is a delicate gambit—a blend of stealth, precision, and screaming death.
cards.name: Goblin Assault
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a 1/1 red Goblin creature token with haste onto the battlefield.
Goblin creatures attack each turn if able.

cards.flavor: Goblin lairs sit high in Jund's mountains. This gives the goblins easy access to the sacrificial peaks above and lets them build up a head of steam before attacking prey down below.
cards.name: Goblin Mountaineer
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

cards.name: Hell's Thunder
cards.text:
Flying, haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Hell's Thunder.
Unearth {4}{R} ({4}{R}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Viashino thrashes keep iguanars as hunting companions, giving them wounded captives as playthings.
cards.name: Hissing Iguanar
cards.text: Whenever another creature dies, you may have Hissing Iguanar deal 1 damage to target player.

cards.flavor: Each mutation causes the incurables to look vastly different from one another. They are left with only one thing in common: their insatiable lust for the slaughter.
cards.name: Incurable Ogre

cards.flavor: "Of your blood I will make my mead, an offering to the thirsty jungle."
cards.name: Jund Battlemage
cards.text:
{B}, {T}: Target player loses 1 life.
{G}, {T}: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"This is going to hurt a lot, but on the bright side, you'll be dead soon."
—Sedris, the Traitor King
cards.name: Lightning Talons
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.flavor:
"Jund is a wounded world. Beware its searing blood spilling out onto the surface."
—Rakka Mar
cards.name: Magma Spray
cards.text: Magma Spray deals 2 damage to target creature. If that creature would die this turn, exile it instead.

cards.flavor: Dragons make for spiteful gods.
cards.name: Predator Dragon
cards.text:
Flying, haste
Devour 2 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with twice that many +1/+1 counters on it.)

cards.name: Resounding Thunder
cards.text:
Resounding Thunder deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
Cycling {5}{B}{R}{G} ({5}{B}{R}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Resounding Thunder, it deals 6 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor:
"Only those with the strength to seize their destiny deserve to have one."
—Nacatl scratchforms
cards.name: Ridge Rannet
cards.text: Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.flavor: On Jund, even the landscape is a deadly hunter. Volcanoes, tar pits, and rock slides seem to prey upon the living.
cards.name: Rockslide Elemental
cards.text:
First strike
Whenever another creature dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Rockslide Elemental.

cards.name: Scourge Devil
cards.text:
When Scourge Devil enters the battlefield, creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
Unearth {2}{R} ({2}{R}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Fire burns away both flesh and freedom.
cards.name: Skeletonize
cards.text: Skeletonize deals 3 damage to target creature. When a creature dealt damage this way dies this turn, put a 1/1 black Skeleton creature token onto the battlefield with "{B}: Regenerate this creature."

cards.flavor: An avatar he sculpts of anger and flame.
cards.name: Soul's Fire
cards.text: Target creature you control on the battlefield deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.

cards.name: Thorn-Thrash Viashino
cards.text:
Devour 2 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with twice that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
{G}: Thorn-Thrash Viashino gains trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Viashino thrashes are led by elders who have survived countless challenges.
cards.name: Thunder-Thrash Elder
cards.text: Devour 3 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with three times that many +1/+1 counters on it.)

cards.flavor: Underneath the Dregscape lay the remains of creatures long extinct from Grixis.
cards.name: Viashino Skeleton
cards.text: {1}{B}, Discard a card: Regenerate Viashino Skeleton.

cards.flavor:
"Thrashes of the ancient past still linger in spirit and shadow, desperate to sink their claws into our souls."
—Rakka Mar
cards.name: Vicious Shadows
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, you may have Vicious Shadows deal damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.

cards.name: Vithian Stinger
cards.text:
{T}: Vithian Stinger deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Unearth {1}{R} ({1}{R}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: A dragon's death is almost as feared as its life. Old, dying dragons throw themselves into volcanoes, causing massive upheaval and widespread disaster.
cards.name: Volcanic Submersion
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact or land.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.flavor:
"Never subtle nor cryptic is the reckoning of the mighty."
—Mayael the Anima
cards.name: Where Ancients Tread
cards.text: Whenever a creature with power 5 or greater enters the battlefield under your control, you may have Where Ancients Tread deal 5 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: It lurks just under the surface, using the algae-choked tar pits of Jund as both home and hunting blind.
cards.name: Algae Gharial
cards.text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Whenever another creature dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Algae Gharial.

cards.flavor: "Mine is an insatiable god, with appetites as magnificent as the jungle itself."
cards.name: Behemoth's Herald
cards.text: {2}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice a red creature, a green creature, and a white creature: Search your library for a card named Godsire and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Natives of Naya know better than to loiter near the mouth of a cave. Two glowing red eyes and the stench of foul breath are all the warning you're likely to get.
cards.name: Cavern Thoctar
cards.text: {1}{R}: Cavern Thoctar gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The Sun-Dappled Court of Valeron stands secure behind a wall of steel-tipped arrows.
cards.name: Court Archers
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.flavor: From her sunsail tent high above the forest floor, an elf harkener can hear the footfalls of a single creature through the cacophony of Naya's jungle sounds.
cards.name: Cylian Elf

cards.flavor: Although the Anima herself remains at the Sacellum, her druids roam Naya, collecting mana bonds with every location in the world.
cards.name: Druid of the Anima
cards.text: {T}: Add {R}, {G}, or {W} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: "I feel the vine-rhythm as my friends drive the beast to me. I will not miss my mark."
cards.name: Drumhunter
cards.text:
At the beginning of your end step, if you control a creature with power 5 or greater, you may draw a card.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Before any major undertaking, a Cylian elf seeks the guidance of a visionary to learn the will of the gargantuan ancients.
cards.name: Elvish Visionary
cards.text: When Elvish Visionary enters the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.flavor: It shreds its prey as each head fights for the choicest bits.
cards.name: Feral Hydra
cards.text:
Feral Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
{3}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Feral Hydra. Any player may activate this ability.

cards.name: Gift of the Gargantuan
cards.text: Look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card and/or a land card from among them and put the revealed cards into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.flavor: "Gargantuans die not in moments but in moons. There is still time to aid this noble ancient."
cards.name: Godtoucher
cards.text: {1}{W}, {T}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target creature with power 5 or greater this turn.

cards.flavor: Weavers' webs wall off swaths of territory more effectively than any portcullis made of iron.
cards.name: Jungle Weaver
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.flavor: He watches over the valley where Progenitus sleeps, culling signs from its steaming breaths.
cards.name: Keeper of Progenitus
cards.text: Whenever a player taps a Mountain, Forest, or Plains for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.

cards.flavor: Naya's bounty spills over upon itself. Each leaf and flower struggles against the next with thrashing thorns, acidic pollen, and strangling roots.
cards.name: Lush Growth
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a Mountain, Forest, and Plains.

cards.flavor: Why settle for mere enormity?
cards.name: Mighty Emergence
cards.text: Whenever a creature with power 5 or greater enters the battlefield under your control, you may put two +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.flavor: Urak froze when he heard it. That was his first mistake. He turned and cast a dramatic ward spell. That was his last.
cards.name: Manaplasm
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, Manaplasm gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.

cards.flavor: Whether gargantuans are the manifested will of Progenitus or simply the result of overabundant resources is moot when a herd of them is thundering at you.
cards.name: Mosstodon
cards.text: {1}: Target creature with power 5 or greater gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Mycoloth
cards.text:
Devour 2 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with twice that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield for each +1/+1 counter on Mycoloth.

cards.flavor: The idols of old are rich in minerals and magic. They are torn apart when nature aims to eat well.
cards.name: Naturalize
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.flavor: "I have trained in all three schools of magic."
cards.name: Naya Battlemage
cards.text:
{R}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.flavor: Jund has little necromancy. Instead, the flesh of its dead gives rise to algal fiends.
cards.name: Ooze Garden
cards.text: {1}{G}, Sacrifice a non-Ooze creature: Put an X/X green Ooze creature token onto the battlefield, where X is the sacrificed creature's power. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.name: Resounding Roar
cards.text:
Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
Cycling {5}{R}{G}{W} ({5}{R}{G}{W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Resounding Roar, target creature gets +6/+6 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Momentum is a great ally."
cards.name: Rhox Charger
cards.text:
Trample
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.flavor: Her connection to the gargantuans puts her in line to become Anima, a sacred but daunting duty.
cards.name: Sacellum Godspeaker
cards.text: {T}: Reveal any number of creature cards with power 5 or greater from your hand. Add {G} to your mana pool for each card revealed this way.

cards.name: Savage Hunger
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has trample.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Skullmulcher
cards.text:
Devour 1 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Skullmulcher enters the battlefield, draw a card for each creature it devoured.

cards.flavor: An avatar he sculpts of instinct and force.
cards.name: Soul's Might
cards.text: Put X +1/+1 counters on target creature, where X is that creature's power.

cards.flavor: Few Nayans dare hunt the gargantuans. They're regarded not as animals but as forces of nature, like landslides or typhoons.
cards.name: Spearbreaker Behemoth
cards.text:
Indestructible
{1}: Target creature with power 5 or greater gains indestructible until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Monks from Topa wander all of Bant, encouraging the Unbeholden to find their place in society through honorable combat.
cards.name: Topan Ascetic
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Topan Ascetic gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "The Cloud Nacatl sit and think, a bunch of soft paws. We are the Claws of Marisi, stalking, pouncing, drawing blood."
cards.name: Wild Nacatl
cards.text:
Wild Nacatl gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Mountain.
Wild Nacatl gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Plains.

cards.flavor: Life's circle has become inverted in Grixis. The same energy is endlessly recycled and becomes more stagnant with each pass.
cards.name: Agony Warp
cards.text:
Target creature gets -3/-0 until end of turn.
Target creature gets -0/-3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ajani Vengeant
cards.text:
+1: Target permanent doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
−2: Ajani Vengeant deals 3 damage to target creature or player and you gain 3 life.
−7: Destroy all lands target player controls.

cards.flavor: Bant is a world where death and chaos hold no sway.
cards.name: Bant Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact.
• Put target creature on the bottom of its owner's library.
• Counter target instant spell.

cards.flavor: While the smell of burning flesh is common in Grixis, the odor of smoldering brain matter is a rare treat.
cards.name: Blightning
cards.text: Blightning deals 3 damage to target player. That player discards two cards.

cards.flavor: "To immortality."
cards.name: Blood Cultist
cards.text:
{T}: Blood Cultist deals 1 damage to target creature.
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Blood Cultist this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Blood Cultist.

cards.flavor:
"Lightning lives in everything, in living flesh and growing things. It must be set free."
—Rakka Mar
cards.name: Branching Bolt
cards.text:
Choose one or both —
• Branching Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature with flying.
• Branching Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature without flying.

cards.flavor: Revealing the truth only deepened Tezzeret's curiosity for the secrets still buried.
cards.name: Brilliant Ultimatum
cards.text: Exile the top five cards of your library. An opponent separates those cards into two piles. You may play any number of cards from one of those piles without paying their mana costs.

cards.flavor: Frozen in fear, the goblins stared upward at the circling hunter—and were promptly eaten by its diving mate.
cards.name: Broodmate Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Broodmate Dragon enters the battlefield, put a 4/4 red Dragon creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: It holds motionless vigil, watching Naya in silence through the screen of the whitecover. When it senses anything amiss, it launches forward with the uncanny sound of torn fog.
cards.name: Bull Cerodon
cards.text: Vigilance, haste

cards.flavor: Viashino hunt in gangs called thrashes. Not all thrashes hunt the freshest game.
cards.name: Carrion Thrash
cards.text: When Carrion Thrash dies, you may pay {2}. If you do, return another target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Be worthy of a single blessing, and many more will follow.
cards.name: Clarion Ultimatum
cards.text: Choose five permanents you control. For each of those permanents, you may search your library for a card with the same name as that permanent. Put those cards onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: There is always a greater power.
cards.name: Cruel Ultimatum
cards.text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature, discards three cards, then loses 5 life. You return a creature card from your graveyard to your hand, draw three cards, then gain 5 life.

cards.flavor: Some Serul Cove rogues traffic in stolen sigils, which fetch a high price from those who would rather pay for honor than earn it.
cards.name: Deft Duelist
cards.text:
First strike
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.flavor: Her wings are the prayers of the devoted; her sword, the despair of the vile.
cards.name: Empyrial Archangel
cards.text:
Flying
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to Empyrial Archangel instead.

cards.flavor:
"Thoughts are commodities. Someone will pay a good price for them. Even ones as simplistic as yours . . ."
—Ennor, mentalist
cards.name: Esper Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target enchantment.
• Draw two cards.
• Target player discards two cards.

cards.name: Fire-Field Ogre
cards.text:
First strike
Unearth {U}{B}{R} ({U}{B}{R}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Every once in a while, when they aren't getting incinerated in lava, crushed under rock slides, or devoured by dragons, goblins experience moments of unmitigated glory in battle.
cards.name: Goblin Deathraiders
cards.text: Trample

cards.flavor:
"Lay sacrifice to the godsire that it may spare us, but save some for his progeny who also will hunger."
—Syeena, elvish godtoucher
cards.name: Godsire
cards.text:
Vigilance
{T}: Put an 8/8 Beast creature token that's red, green, and white onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"So many choices. Shall I choose loathing, hate, or malice today?"
—Eliza of the Keep
cards.name: Grixis Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
• Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
• Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"The dragon has no pretense of compassion, no false mask of civilization—just hunger, heat, and need."
—Sarkhan Vol
cards.name: Hellkite Overlord
cards.text:
Flying, trample, haste
{R}: Hellkite Overlord gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{B}{G}: Regenerate Hellkite Overlord.

cards.flavor: Centuries of careful practice have elevated the casting of protective spells to an art form. What little offensive magic remains on Bant stands little chance of breaching them.
cards.name: Hindering Light
cards.text:
Counter target spell that targets you or a permanent you control.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: The Jhessian navy makes successful raids on Valeron's coastal towns thanks to their spies planted during peacetime.
cards.name: Jhessian Infiltrator
cards.text: Jhessian Infiltrator can't be blocked.

cards.flavor: Jund pulses with raw energy, waiting for shamans to shape it into useful form.
cards.name: Jund Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Exile all cards from target player's graveyard.
• Jund Charm deals 2 damage to each creature.
• Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature.

cards.flavor: Bloated with venom, it crawls Grixis looking for victims to ooze onto.
cards.name: Kederekt Creeper
cards.text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.flavor: Once a year, Akrasa holds a joust that draws knights and their leotaus from every nation on Bant. The prize is an Akrasan sigil, but the true reward is the angel's kiss.
cards.name: Kiss of the Amesha
cards.text: Target player gains 7 life and draws two cards.

cards.flavor: Each of his twenty-two braids is bound with bone and leather from a foe.
cards.name: Kresh the Bloodbraided
cards.text: Whenever another creature dies, you may put X +1/+1 counters on Kresh the Bloodbraided, where X is that creature's power.

cards.flavor: The sacred Anima's eyes are blind to all but the grandest truths.
cards.name: Mayael the Anima
cards.text: {3}{R}{G}{W}, {T}: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may put a creature card with power 5 or greater from among them onto the battlefield. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.flavor: Deep in nature's core lies a potential unsullied by greed or civilization.
cards.name: Naya Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Naya Charm deals 3 damage to target creature.
• Return target card from a graveyard to its owner's hand.
• Tap all creatures target player controls.

cards.flavor:
"Those may be the squirms of one life ending or of another beginning. Either way, I'd leave it alone."
—Rakka Mar
cards.name: Necrogenesis
cards.text: {2}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: "There are none alive that I cannot crush. There are none dead that I do not command."
cards.name: Prince of Thralls
cards.text: Whenever a permanent an opponent controls is put into a graveyard, put that card onto the battlefield under your control unless that opponent pays 3 life.

cards.flavor:
"Amateurish. Nearsighted. A waste of my time and everyone else's."
—Indra, nullmage of Vectis
cards.name: Punish Ignorance
cards.text: Counter target spell. Its controller loses 3 life and you gain 3 life.

cards.flavor: The surprise of a battle cry can be as deadly as a blade.
cards.name: Qasali Ambusher
cards.text:
Reach
If a creature is attacking you and you control a Forest and a Plains, you may cast Qasali Ambusher without paying its mana cost and as though it had flash.

cards.flavor: Many sigils, one purpose.
cards.name: Rafiq of the Many
cards.text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, it gains double strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Naya teems with gargantuans, titanic monsters to whom both nature and civilization defer.
cards.name: Rakeclaw Gargantuan
cards.text: {1}: Target creature with power 5 or greater gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The behemoth roared, and the world was blasted free of empires and tyrants.
cards.name: Realm Razer
cards.text:
When Realm Razer enters the battlefield, exile all lands.
When Realm Razer leaves the battlefield, return the exiled cards to the battlefield tapped under their owners' control.

cards.flavor: Rhox monks are dedicated to spiritual growth and learning, and most bear the sigils of many students. However, they do not gladly suffer fools or those who disagree with their carefully wrought dogma.
cards.name: Rhox War Monk
cards.text: Lifelink

cards.flavor: If you breathe, she will fight you. If you breathe fire, she must fight you.
cards.name: Rip-Clan Crasher
cards.text: Haste

cards.flavor: Some believe the spiky crystal called sangrite is concentrated dragon's breath. Others think it's crystallized life energy. The clans care only about the power it unleashes when crushed.
cards.name: Sangrite Surge
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains double strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Sarkhan Vol
cards.text:
+1: Creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain haste until end of turn.
−2: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.
−6: Put five 4/4 red Dragon creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Sedraxis Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Sedraxis Specter deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.
Unearth {1}{B} ({1}{B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: He bids his minions rise from their graves to their knees.
cards.name: Sedris, the Traitor King
cards.text: Each creature card in your graveyard has unearth {2}{B}. ({2}{B}: Return the card to the battlefield. The creature gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: To gain audience with the hegemon, one must bring a riddle she has not heard.
cards.name: Sharuum the Hegemon
cards.text:
Flying
When Sharuum the Hegemon enters the battlefield, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor: "For unwavering commitment and unflinching strength, the Order of the White Orchid confers its sigil. Rise, knight-captain, and do your duty."
cards.name: Sigil Blessing
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature you control gets +3/+3 and other creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.flavor: "What rises without legs, whispers without a voice, bites without teeth, and dies without having life?"
cards.name: Sphinx Sovereign
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your end step, you gain 3 life if Sphinx Sovereign is untapped. Otherwise, each opponent loses 3 life.

cards.flavor: The vast network of predation on Jund has actually caused some strange creatures to adapt to being eaten.
cards.name: Sprouting Thrinax
cards.text: When Sprouting Thrinax dies, put three 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Knight-stewards guard the Sun-Dappled Court, a grove of immense, sculptured olive trees that represent Valeron's twelve noble families.
cards.name: Steward of Valeron
cards.text:
Vigilance
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Even the most battle-hardened soldiers pause in her presence for a moment of introspection.
cards.name: Stoic Angel
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
Players can't untap more than one creature during their untap steps.

cards.flavor:
"We can't beat the necromancers in numbers or raw power. We must beat them with ingenuity and timing."
—Rannon, Vithian holdout
cards.name: Swerve
cards.text: Change the target of target spell with a single target.

cards.flavor: Agents of the Architects of Will mark their victims as a reminder that their secrets are secret no longer.
cards.name: Thoughtcutter Agent
cards.text: {U}{B}, {T}: Target player loses 1 life and reveals his or her hand.

cards.name: Tidehollow Sculler
cards.text:
When Tidehollow Sculler enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals his or her hand and you choose a nonland card from it. Exile that card.
When Tidehollow Sculler leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: The scullers beneath Esper keep strixes as trained pets, and set them loose when a fare refuses to pay.
cards.name: Tidehollow Strix
cards.text:
Flying
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.flavor:
"Retribution is best delivered by claws and rage, with both magnified."
—Ajani
cards.name: Titanic Ultimatum
cards.text: Until end of turn, creatures you control get +5/+5 and gain first strike, lifelink, and trample.

cards.flavor:
"Esper, like any work of art, can be truly appreciated only from a distance."
—Tezzeret
cards.name: Tower Gargoyle
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor:
"Words are a waste of time. Destruction is a language everyone understands."
—Sarkhan Vol
cards.name: Violent Ultimatum
cards.text: Destroy three target permanents.

cards.flavor: The greatest gift you can give a sea aven is solitude.
cards.name: Waveskimmer Aven
cards.text:
Flying
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.flavor: She knows the names and secrets of each of Esper's twenty-three winds.
cards.name: Windwright Mage
cards.text:
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
Windwright Mage has flying as long as an artifact card is in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: One of the most ferocious and deadly gargantuans, the thoctar never sees its worshippers, but it often awakens surrounded by gifts and sacrifices.
cards.name: Woolly Thoctar

cards.flavor: It shows not what you are but what you were.
cards.name: Lich's Mirror
cards.text: If you would lose the game, instead shuffle your hand, your graveyard, and all permanents you own into your library, then draw seven cards and your life total becomes 20.

cards.flavor: To crack a mirror is to provide an opening for the reflection to escape.
cards.name: Minion Reflector
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {2}. If you do, put a token that's a copy of that creature onto the battlefield. That token has haste and "At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice this permanent."

cards.flavor: Whether incorporated into the structure of castles or admired as lone symbols, the obelisks stand for Bant's values of loyalty, honor, and truth.
cards.name: Obelisk of Bant
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}, {W}, or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: It is a monument as austere, unyielding, and inscrutable as Esper itself.
cards.name: Obelisk of Esper
cards.text: {T}: Add {W}, {U}, or {B} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Like most features of Grixis, the obelisks that remain from the time of Alara now exist only for dark exploitation.
cards.name: Obelisk of Grixis
cards.text: {T}: Add {U}, {B}, or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Volcanic ash-winds batter it, climbing vines overwhelm it, dragonfire roasts it, and yet it still stands as a testament to a forgotten world.
cards.name: Obelisk of Jund
cards.text: {T}: Add {B}, {R}, or {G} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Centuries have passed since the plane shattered, yet the obelisks of each shard faithfully serve their long-forgotten purpose.
cards.name: Obelisk of Naya
cards.text: {T}: Add {R}, {G}, or {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Quietus Spike

cards.flavor: Elves believe the hydra-god Progenitus sleeps beneath Naya, feeding on forgotten magics.
cards.name: Relic of Progenitus
cards.text:
{T}: Target player exiles a card from his or her graveyard.
{1}, Exile Relic of Progenitus: Exile all cards from all graveyards. Draw a card.

cards.name: Sigil of Distinction
cards.text:
Sigil of Distinction enters the battlefield with X charge counters on it.
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each charge counter on Sigil of Distinction.
Equip—Remove a charge counter from Sigil of Distinction.

cards.flavor:
"We must rely on our own knowledge, not on the dogma of the seekers or the mutterings of the sphinxes."
—Tullus of Palandius
cards.name: Arcane Sanctum
cards.text:
Arcane Sanctum enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W}, {U}, or {B} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Bant's hearts are as pure as its air and as bright as its skies.
cards.name: Bant Panorama
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Bant Panorama: Search your library for a basic Forest, Plains, or Island card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"They say the ruins of Sedraxis were once a shining capital in Vithia. Now it is a blight, a place to be avoided by the living."
—Olcot, Rider of Joffik
cards.name: Crumbling Necropolis
cards.text:
Crumbling Necropolis enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U}, {B}, or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Esper is an expansive canvas painted by precise, controlling hands.
cards.name: Esper Panorama
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Esper Panorama: Search your library for a basic Plains, Island, or Swamp card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: There is no height above Grixis that is free from the stench of death.
cards.name: Grixis Panorama
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Grixis Panorama: Search your library for a basic Island, Swamp, or Mountain card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: The sky is the dragon's throne, the seat from which it issues its fiery decrees.
cards.name: Jund Panorama
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Jund Panorama: Search your library for a basic Swamp, Mountain, or Forest card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: On Naya, ambition and treachery are scarce, hunted nearly to extinction by the awe owed to terrestrial gods.
cards.name: Jungle Shrine
cards.text:
Jungle Shrine enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R}, {G}, or {W} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Between the thunderous footfalls of Naya's behemoths lie moments of perfect quiet.
cards.name: Naya Panorama
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Naya Panorama: Search your library for a basic Mountain, Forest, or Plains card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Jund is a world as cruel as those who call it home. Their brutal struggles scar the land even as it carves them in its image, a vicious circle spiraling out of control.
cards.name: Savage Lands
cards.text:
Savage Lands enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B}, {R}, or {G} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: For wisdom's sake, it was built high to gaze on all things. For glory's sake, it was built high as a testament of power. For strength's sake, it was built high to repel all attacks.
cards.name: Seaside Citadel
cards.text:
Seaside Citadel enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}, {W}, or {U} to your mana pool.
